meanings.definition: A small valve used to control the flow of liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic adjusted the petcock to stop the fuel flow.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to turn the petcock to control the water flow.
meanings.sent3: The petcock on the tank made a funny noise when turned.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved the petcock like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The shiny petcock gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To use a petcock to regulate the flow of fuel.
meanings.sent1: He will petcock the gas tank before starting the engine.
meanings.sent2: Remember to petcock the valve gently to avoid spills.
meanings.sent3: She always jokes that she can petcock like a pro.
meanings.sent4: His ability to petcock efficiently saved him time and money.
meanings.sent5: The way he petcocked showed his experience and skill in handling machinery.

meanings.definition: The act of turning a petcock to stop or start the flow of liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: With a quick twist, the petcock shut off the water supply.
meanings.sent2: The old bike required a firm grip to turn the petcock.
meanings.sent3: The petcock dance at the factory party was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: In an emergency, knowing how to operate the petcock is crucial.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the petcock turning echoed in the quiet room, breaking the silence.
